text:
Artem Kahan (; 1 May 1985, Kirawsk, Belarusian SSR) is a Russian-Israeli entrepreneur and businessman. He is co-founder of Reload Motors GmbH, which develops batteries and components for passenger and commercial electric vehicles, industrial and home power storage devices, and solutions for the secondary use of lithium-ion batteries. Ex co-founder of the first unofficial Tesla dealership in Russia.
Biography.
Artem Kahan was born in 1985 in Kirawsk, Belarus.
He graduated from Mogilev Regional Lyceum No. 3, economic and legal profile. In 2007, he graduated from the Belarusian State University, faculty of international relations.
In 2007—2010, Artem Kahan served as the head of the Mercedes-Benz dealer for special trucks.
In 2010—2014, he opened and managed a Mercedes-Benz truck and commercial vehicle dealership in Moscow.
In 2014—2015, Artem was a co-founder of Global Motors, a car supplier from the United States to Russia and the CIS.
In 2015—2017, Artem Kahan co-founded the [https://moscowteslaclub.ru Moscow Tesla Club], the first unofficial Tesla dealership in Russia. The company specialized in deliveries of Tesla cars to Russia and the CIS.
In 2017, Artem Kahan founded together with two partners the Reload Motors brand, which develops batteries and components for passenger and commercial electric vehicles, industrial and home power storage devices, and solutions for the secondary use of lithium-ion batteries.
In 2019, he joined as a co-founder [https://maxbionic.com Maxbionic], a company that specializes in bionic prosthetics and robotics technologies.
Personal life.
Artem Kahan is married and has three children.
